org.jcvi.jillion.sam

Class SamFileWriterBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.sam.SamFileWriterBuilder

  • public final class SamFileWriterBuilder
extends Object
    SamFileWriterBuilder is a Builder object that will create a SamWriter implementation to write out either SAM or BAM formatted files and optionally re-sort them. If resorting the SamRecords, temp data will be written to a temp directory. By default, the system's temp directory is used but that can be changed by using the setTempRootDir(File) method.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Detail

      • SamFileWriterBuilder

        public SamFileWriterBuilder(File outputFile,
                            SamHeader header)
        Create a new SamFileWriterBuilder instance that will write out SamRecords to the given output file. The file encoding to use is determined by the file extension of the output file.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - the output file to write to; can not be null. the File extension must be either ".sam" or ".bam".
        header - the SamHeader; can not be null. The sort order in the header may be overridden by reSortBy(SortOrder) or reSortBy(SortOrder, int) or forceHeaderSortOrder(SortOrder).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultRecordsToKeepInMemory

        public static int getDefaultRecordsToKeepInMemory()
        Get the max number of SamRecords to keep in memory at any one time if re-sorting on the fly.
        Returns:
        an int will always be >=0.

      • setTempRootDir

        public SamFileWriterBuilder setTempRootDir(File tmpDir)
        Change the temp directory to write re-sorted temp data to when writing out the SAM or BAM file. If this method is not called, then the default system temp directory is used.
        Parameters:
        tmpDir - the temp directory to use; if null, then use the default system temp directory. If this temp directory does not exist, it will be created if used.
        Returns:
        this.

      • setSamAttributeValidator

        public SamFileWriterBuilder setSamAttributeValidator(SamAttributeValidator validator)
        Set a SamAttributeValidator to use to confirm that the SamRecords given to the writer are valid for this SamHeader. If not provided, then a default validator that only knows about ReservedSamAttributeKeys will be used.
        Parameters:
        validator - the validator to use; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if validator is null.

      • createBamIndex

        public SamFileWriterBuilder createBamIndex(boolean createBamIndex)
        Should a corresponding BAM Index file also be created (false by default). Convenience method for createBamIndex(createBamIndex, false).

        If the Bam file should make an index and the SortOrder is not set to SortOrder.COORDINATE by the time build() is called, then build() will throw an IllegalStateException. The exception throw is delayed until as late as possible so that you can later call either reSortBy(SortOrder) or forceHeaderSortOrder(SortOrder) to specify SortOrder.COORDINATE sorting after calling this method.

        If createBamIndex is true, AND the file to be written is a BAM file AND the sort order is SortOrder.COORDINATE, then an additional file named "$outputFile#getName.bam.bai" will also be created in the same directory as the outputFile.

        So for example, if the outputFile was myOutput.bam then the index file to be written will be named myOutput.bam.bai. If this method is not called, then by default, the metadata is not included.

        Parameters:
        createBamIndex - should a BAM index be created? true if it should; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        createBamIndex(boolean, boolean)

      • createBamIndex

        public SamFileWriterBuilder createBamIndex(boolean createBamIndex,
                                           boolean includeMetadata)
        Should a corresponding BAM Index file also be created (false by default). If createBamIndex is true, AND the file to be written is a BAM file AND the sort order is SortOrder.COORDINATE, then an additional file named "$outputFile#getName.bam.bai" will also be created in the same directory as the outputFile.

        If the Bam file should make an index and the SortOrder is not set to SortOrder.COORDINATE by the time build() is called, then build() will throw an IllegalStateException. The exception throw is delayed until as late as possible so that you can later call either reSortBy(SortOrder) or forceHeaderSortOrder(SortOrder) to specify SortOrder.COORDINATE sorting after calling this method.

        So for example, if the outputFile was myOutput.bam then the index file to be written will be named myOutput.bam.bai. If this method is not called, then by default, the metadata is not included.

        Parameters:
        createBamIndex - should a BAM index be created? true if it should; false otherwise.
        includeMetadata - Some BAM indexes created by some other SAM libraries such as samtools and picard add additional metadata to the index such as the number of unaligned reads. This metadata is not specified in the BAM Index specification so some SAM parsers might not be able to correctly handle them. If this parameter is set to true if metadata should be included; false otherwise (the default).
        Returns:
        this.

      • reSortBy

        public SamFileWriterBuilder reSortBy(SortOrder sortOrder)
        Convenience method to resort using the default number of records to get in memory specified by getDefaultRecordsToKeepInMemory(). Same as reSortBy(sortOrder, getDefaultRecordsToKeepInMemory()
        Parameters:
        sortOrder - the SortOrder to use; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        reSortBy(SortOrder, int)

      • reSortBy

        public SamFileWriterBuilder reSortBy(SortOrder sortOrder,
                                     int maxRecordsToKeepInMemory)
        Resort the SamRecords written by this writer on the fly. This will also modify the SAM/BAM header written out to specify the correct sort order. NOTE: Setting SortOrder.UNKNOWN or SortOrder.UNSORTED will not cause a re-sort on the fly but the header written will still be modified.
        Parameters:
        sortOrder - the SortOrder to use; can not be null.
        maxRecordsToKeepInMemory - the number of SamRecords to keep in memory; must be >0.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sortOrder is not specified.
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxRecordsToKeepInMemory < 1.

      • forceHeaderSortOrder

        public SamFileWriterBuilder forceHeaderSortOrder(SortOrder sortOrder)
        Change the sort order specified in the written out header but do not actually re-sort the records on the fly. This method should be used with care and should only be used if the records are already known to be sorted but for some reason the provided header has the wrong sort order.
        Parameters:
        sortOrder - the sort order to use; if null, then the sort order will be set to SortOrder.UNKNOWN.
        Returns:
        this.

      • build

        public SamWriter build()
                throws IOException
        Create a new SamWriter instance using the provided configuration.
        Returns:
        a new SamWriter will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the output directories or temp areas.
        IllegalStateException - if the bam file to be written should also make an index file, but the sort order is not SortOrder.COORDINATE which is required by index files.
